intro: Prinos punctatus, commonly known as the spotted prion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. Prinos punctatus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
